controls.title: Inventory and Control of Enterprise Assets

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Actively manage (inventory, track, and correct) all enterprise assets (end-user devices, including portable and mobile; network devices; non-computing/Internet of Things (IoT) devices; and servers) connected to the infrastructure physically, virtually, remotely, and those within cloud environments, to accurately know the totality of assets that need to be monitored and protected within the enterprise. This will also support identifying unauthorized and unmanaged assets to remove or remediate.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain Detailed Enterprise Asset Inventory

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain an accurate, detailed, and up-to-date inventory of all enterprise assets with the potential to store or process data, to include: end-user devices (including portable and mobile), network devices, non-computing/IoT devices, and servers. Ensure the inventory records the network address (if static), hardware address, machine name, enterprise asset owner, department for each asset, and whether the asset has been approved to connect to the network. For mobile end-user devices, MDM type tools can support this process, where appropriate. This inventory includes assets connected to the infrastructure physically, virtually, remotely, and those within cloud environments. Additionally, it includes assets that are regularly connected to the enterprise's network infrastructure, even if they are not under control of the enterprise. Review and update the inventory of all enterprise assets bi-annually, or more frequently.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: An accurate, detailed, and up-to-date inventory is established and maintained for all enterprise assets with the potential to store or process data.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose:
Enterprise assets include: end-user devices (including portable and mobile), network devices, non-computing/IoT devices, and servers.

The inventory includes assets connected to the infrastructure physically, virtually, remotely, and those within cloud environments. Additionally, it includes assets that are regularly connected to the enterprise's network infrastructure, even if they are not under control of the enterprise.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The inventory records the network address (if static), hardware address, machine name, enterprise asset owner, department for each asset, and whether the asset has been approved to connect to the network. For mobile end-user devices, MDM type tools can support this process, where appropriate.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The inventory is reviewed and updated for all enterprise assets bi-annually, or more frequently.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Ensure that a process exists to address unauthorized assets on a weekly basis. The enterprise may choose to remove the asset from the network, deny the asset from connecting remotely to the network, or quarantine the asset.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A process exists to address unauthorized assets.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The enterprise removes the asset from the network, denies the asset from connecting remotely to the network, or quarantines the asset.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Unauthorized assets are addressed on a weekly basis.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Utilize an active discovery tool to identify assets connected to the enterprise's network. Configure the active discovery tool to execute daily, or more frequently.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: An active discovery tool is used to identify assets connected to the enterprise's network.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The active discovery tool is configured to execute daily, or more frequently.

controls.title: Use Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) Logging to Update Enterprise Asset Inventory

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Use DHCP logging on all DHCP servers or Internet Protocol (IP) address management tools to update the enterprise's asset inventory. Review and use logs to update the enterprise's asset inventory weekly, or more frequently.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: DHCP logging is used on all DHCP servers or Internet Protocol (IP) address management tools to update the enterprise's asset inventory.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The logs are reviewed and used to update the enterprise's asset inventory weekly, or more frequently.

controls.title: Use a Passive Asset Discovery Tool

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Use a passive discovery tool to identify assets connected to the enterprise's network. Review and use scans to update the enterprise's asset inventory at least weekly, or more frequently.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A passive discovery tool is used to identify assets connected to the enterprise's network.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The scans are reviewed and used to update the enterprise's asset inventory at least weekly, or more frequently.

controls.title: Inventory and Control of Software Assets

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Actively manage (inventory, track, and correct) all software (operating systems and applications) on the network so that only authorized software is installed and can execute, and that unauthorized and unmanaged software is found and prevented from installation or execution.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Software Inventory

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain a detailed inventory of all licensed software installed on enterprise assets. The software inventory must document the title, publisher, initial install/use date, and business purpose for each entry; where appropriate, include the Uniform Resource Locator (URL), app store(s), version(s), deployment mechanism, decommission date, and number of licenses. Review and update the software inventory bi-annually, or more frequently.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A detailed inventory is established and maintained for all licensed software installed on enterprise assets.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The software inventory documents the title, publisher, initial install/use date, and business purpose for each entry; where appropriate, the Uniform Resource Locator (URL), app store(s), version(s), deployment mechanism, and decommission date.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The software inventory is reviewed and updated bi-annually, or more frequently.

controls.title: Ensure Authorized Software is Currently Supported

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Ensure that only currently supported software is designated as authorized in the software inventory for enterprise assets. If software is unsupported, yet necessary for the fulfillment of the enterprise's mission, document an exception detailing mitigating controls and residual risk acceptance. For any unsupported software without an exception documentation, designate as unauthorized. Review the software list to verify software support at least monthly, or more frequently.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Only currently supported software is designated as authorized in the software inventory for enterprise assets.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: An exception is documented, detailing mitigating controls and residual risk acceptance, for software that is unsupported, yet necessary for the fulfillment of the enterprise's mission.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Unsupported software without an exception documentation is designated as unauthorized.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The software list is reviewed at least monthly, or more frequently, to verify software support.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Ensure that unauthorized software is either removed from use on enterprise assets or receives a documented exception. Review monthly, or more frequently.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Unauthorized software is either removed from use on enterprise assets or receives a documented exception.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A review for unauthorized software occurs monthly, or more frequently.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Utilize software inventory tools, when possible, throughout the enterprise to automate the discovery and documentation of installed software.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Software inventory tools, when possible, are used throughout the enterprise to automate the discovery and documentation of installed software.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Use technical controls, such as application allowlisting, to ensure that only authorized software can execute or be accessed. Reassess bi-annually, or more frequently.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Technical controls, such as application allowlisting, are used to ensure that only authorized software can execute or be accessed.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Reassess authorized software bi-annually, or more frequently.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Use technical controls to ensure that only authorized software libraries, such as specific .dll, .ocx, and .so files, are allowed to load into a system process. Block unauthorized libraries from loading into a system process. Reassess bi-annually, or more frequently.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Technical controls are used to ensure that only authorized software libraries, such as specific .dll, .ocx, and .so files, are allowed to load into a system process.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Unauthorized libraries are blocked from loading into a system process.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Authorized libraries are reassessed bi-annually, or more frequently.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Use technical controls, such as digital signatures and version control, to ensure that only authorized scripts, such as specific .ps1, and .py files are allowed to execute. Block unauthorized scripts from executing. Reassess bi-annually, or more frequently.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Technical controls, such as digital signatures and version control, are used to ensure that only authorized scripts, such as specific .ps1, and .py files are allowed to execute.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Unauthorized scripts are blocked from executing.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Authorized scripts are reassessed bi-annually, or more frequently.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Develop processes and technical controls to identify, classify, securely handle, retain, and dispose of data.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Management Process

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain a documented data management process. In the process, address data sensitivity, data owner, handling of data, data retention limits, and disposal requirements, based on sensitivity and retention standards for the enterprise. Review and update documentation annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A documented data management process is established and maintained.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Data sensitivity, data owner, handling of data, data retention limits, and disposal requirements, based on sensitivity and retention standards for the enterprise, are addressed within the process.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Documentation is updated and reviewed annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Inventory

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain a data inventory based on the enterprise's data management process. Inventory sensitive data, at a minimum. Review and update inventory annually, at a minimum, with a priority on sensitive data.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A data inventory is established and maintained, based on the enterprise's data management process.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Sensitive data is inventoried, at a minimum.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Inventory is reviewed and updated annually, at a minimum, with a priority on sensitive data.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Configure data access control lists based on a user's need to know. Apply data access control lists, also known as access permissions, to local and remote file systems, databases, and applications.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Data access control lists are configured based on a user's need to know.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Data access control lists, also known as access permissions, are applied to local and remote file systems, databases, and applications.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Retain data according to the enterprise's documented data management process. Data retention must include both minimum and maximum timelines.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Data is retained according to the enterprise's documented data management process.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Data retention includes both minimum and maximum timelines.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Securely dispose of data as outlined in the enterprise's documented data management process. Ensure the disposal process and method are commensurate with the data sensitivity.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Data is securely disposed of, as outlined in the enterprise's documented data management process.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The disposal process and method are commensurate with the data sensitivity.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Encrypt data on end-user devices containing sensitive data. Example implementations can include: Windows BitLocker, Apple FileVault, Linux dm-crypt.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Data is encrypted on end-user devices containing sensitive data.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations can include: Windows BitLocker, Apple FileVault, Linux dm-crypt.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Classification Scheme

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain an overall data classification scheme for the enterprise. Enterprises may use labels, such as "Sensitive," "Confidential," and "Public," and classify their data according to those labels. Review and update the classification scheme annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: An overall data classification scheme is established and maintained for the enterprise.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Enterprises use labels, such as "Sensitive," "Confidential," and "Public," and classify their data according to those labels.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The classification scheme is reviewed and updated annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Document data flows. Data flow documentation includes service provider data flows and should be based on the enterprise's data management process. Review and update documentation annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Data flows are documented.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Data flow documentation includes service provider data flows and is based on the enterprise's data management process.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Documentation is reviewed and updated annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Encrypt data on removable media.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Data on removable media is encrypted.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Encrypt sensitive data in transit. Example implementations can include: Transport Layer Security (TLS) and Open Secure Shell (OpenSSH).

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Sensitive data in transit is encrypted.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations can include: Transport Layer Security (TLS) and Open Secure Shell (OpenSSH).

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Encrypt sensitive data at rest on servers, applications, and databases. Storage-layer encryption, also known as server-side encryption, meets the minimum requirement of this Safeguard. Additional encryption methods may include application-layer encryption, also known as client-side encryption, where access to the data storage device(s) does not permit access to the plain-text data.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Sensitive data at rest is encrypted on servers, applications, and databases.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose:
Storage-layer encryption, also known as server-side encryption, meets the minimum requirement of this Safeguard.

Additional encryption methods include application-layer encryption, also known as client-side encryption, where access to the data storage device(s) does not permit access to the plain-text data.

controls.title: Segment Data Processing and Storage Based on Sensitivity

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Segment data processing and storage based on the sensitivity of the data. Do not process sensitive data on enterprise assets intended for lower sensitivity data.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Data processing and storage is segmented based on the sensitivity of the data.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Sensitive data is not processed on enterprise assets intended for lower sensitivity data.

controls.title: Deploy a Data Loss Prevention Solution

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Implement an automated tool, such as a host-based Data Loss Prevention (DLP) tool to identify all sensitive data stored, processed, or transmitted through enterprise assets, including those located onsite or at a remote service provider, and update the enterprise's data inventory.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: An automated tool, such as a host-based Data Loss Prevention (DLP) tool, is implemented.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The data loss prevention solution identifies all sensitive data stored, processed, or transmitted through enterprise assets, including those located onsite or at a remote service provider.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: As a result, the enterprise's data inventory is updated.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Log sensitive data access, including modification and disposal.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Sensitive data access is logged, including modification and disposal.

controls.title: Secure Configuration of Enterprise Assets and Software

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain the secure configuration of enterprise assets (end-user devices, including portable and mobile; network devices; non-computing/IoT devices; and servers) and software (operating systems and applications).

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Secure Configuration Process

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain a documented secure configuration process for enterprise assets (end-user devices, including portable and mobile, non-computing/IoT devices, and servers) and software (operating systems and applications). Review and update documentation annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A documented secure configuration process is established and maintained for enterprise assets (end-user devices, including portable and mobile, non-computing/IoT devices, and servers) and software (operating systems and applications).

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Documentation is reviewed and updated annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Secure Configuration Process for Network Infrastructure

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain a documented secure configuration process for network devices. Review and update documentation annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A documented secure configuration process is established and maintained for network devices.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Documentation is reviewed and updated annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

controls.title: Configure Automatic Session Locking on Enterprise Assets

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Configure automatic session locking on enterprise assets after a defined period of inactivity. For general purpose operating systems, the period must not exceed 15 minutes. For mobile end-user devices, the period must not exceed 2 minutes.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Automatic session locking is configured on enterprise assets after a defined period of inactivity.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: For general purpose operating systems, the period does not exceed 15 minutes.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: For mobile end-user devices, the period does not exceed two (2) minutes.

controls.title: Implement and Manage a Firewall on Servers

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Implement and manage a firewall on servers, where supported. Example implementations include a virtual firewall, operating system firewall, or a third-party firewall agent.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A firewall is implemented and managed on servers, where supported.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations include a virtual firewall, operating system firewall, or a third-party firewall agent.

controls.title: Implement and Manage a Firewall on End-User Devices

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Implement and manage a host-based firewall or port-filtering tool on end-user devices, with a default-deny rule that drops all traffic except those services and ports that are explicitly allowed.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A host-based firewall or port-filtering tool is implemented and managed on end-user devices.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A default-deny rule is in place that drops all traffic except those services and ports that are explicitly allowed.

controls.title: Securely Manage Enterprise Assets and Software

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Securely manage enterprise assets and software. Example implementations include managing configuration through version-controlled Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) and accessing administrative interfaces over secure network protocols, such as Secure Shell (SSH) and Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS). Do not use insecure management protocols, such as Telnet (Teletype Network) and HTTP, unless operationally essential.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Enterprise assets and software are securely managed.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Insecure management protocols are not used, such as Telnet (Teletype Network) and HTTP, unless operationally essential.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations include managing configuration through version-controlled Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) and accessing administrative interfaces over secure network protocols, such as Secure Shell (SSH) and Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS).

controls.title: Manage Default Accounts on Enterprise Assets and Software

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Manage default accounts on enterprise assets and software, such as root, administrator, and other pre-configured vendor accounts. Example implementations can include: disabling default accounts or making them unusable.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Default accounts are managed on enterprise assets and software, such as root, administrator, and other pre-configured vendor accounts.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations can include: disabling default accounts or making them unusable.

controls.title: Uninstall or Disable Unnecessary Services on Enterprise Assets and Software

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Uninstall or disable unnecessary services on enterprise assets and software, such as an unused file sharing service, web application module, or service function.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Unnecessary services are uninstalled or disabled on enterprise assets and software.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Examples include disabling or uninstalling an unused file sharing service, web application module, or service function.

controls.title: Configure Trusted DNS Servers on Enterprise Assets

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Configure trusted DNS servers on network infrastructure. Example implementations include configuring network devices to use enterprise-controlled DNS servers and/or reputable externally accessible DNS servers.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Trusted DNS servers are configured on network infrastructure.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations include configuring network devices to use enterprise-controlled DNS servers and/or reputable externally accessible DNS servers.

controls.title: Enforce Automatic Device Lockout on Portable End-User Devices

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Enforce automatic device lockout following a predetermined threshold of local failed authentication attempts on portable end-user devices, where supported. For laptops, do not allow more than 20 failed authentication attempts; for tablets and smartphones, no more than 10 failed authentication attempts. Example implementations include Microsoft InTune Device Lock and Apple Configuration Profile maxFailedAttempts.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Automatic device lockout is enforced following a predetermined threshold of local failed authentication attempts on portable end-user devices, where supported.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: For laptops, no more than 20 failed authentication attempts are allowed.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: For tablets and smartphones, no more than 10 failed authentication attempts are allowed.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations include Microsoft InTune Device Lock and Apple Configuration Profile maxFailedAttempts.

controls.title: Enforce Remote Wipe Capability on Portable End-User Devices

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Remotely wipe enterprise data from enterprise-owned portable end-user devices when deemed appropriate such as lost or stolen devices, or when an individual no longer supports the enterprise.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Enterprise data is wiped from enterprise-owned portable end-user devices when deemed appropriate.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example situations include when devices are lost or stolen, or when an individual no longer supports the enterprise.

controls.title: Separate Enterprise Workspaces on Mobile End-User Devices

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Ensure separate enterprise workspaces are used on mobile end-user devices, where supported. Example implementations include using an Apple Configuration Profile or Android Work Profile to separate enterprise applications and data from personal applications and data.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Separate enterprise workspaces are used on mobile end-user devices, where supported.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations include using an Apple Configuration Profile or Android Work Profile to separate enterprise applications and data from personal applications and data.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Use processes and tools to assign and manage authorization to credentials for user accounts, including administrator accounts, as well as service accounts, to enterprise assets and software.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Accounts

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain an inventory of all accounts managed in the enterprise. The inventory must at a minimum include user, administrator, and service accounts. The inventory, at a minimum, should contain the person's name, username, start/stop dates, and department. Validate that all active accounts are authorized, on a recurring schedule at a minimum quarterly, or more frequently.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: An inventory of all accounts managed in the enterprise is established and maintained.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The inventory includes, at a minimum, user, administrator accounts, and service accounts.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The inventory, at a minimum, contains the person's name, username, start/stop dates, and department.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: All active accounts are validated and authorized, on a recurring schedule, at a minimum, quarterly, or more frequently.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Use unique passwords for all enterprise assets. Best practice implementation includes, at a minimum, an 8-character password for accounts using Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) and a 14-character password for accounts not using MFA.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Unique passwords are used for all enterprise assets.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Best practice implementation includes, at a minimum, an 8-character password for accounts using Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) and a 14-character password for accounts not using MFA.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Delete or disable any dormant accounts after a period of 45 days of inactivity, where supported.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Dormant accounts are deleted or disabled after a period of 45 days of inactivity, where supported.

controls.title: Restrict Administrator Privileges to Dedicated Administrator Accounts

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Restrict administrator privileges to dedicated administrator accounts on enterprise assets. Conduct general computing activities, such as internet browsing, email, and productivity suite use, from the user's primary, non-privileged account.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Administrator privileges are restricted to dedicated administrator accounts on enterprise assets.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: General computing activities, such as internet browsing, email, and productivity suite use, are conducted from the user's primary, non-privileged account.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Service Accounts

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain an inventory of service accounts. The inventory, at a minimum, must contain department owner, review date, and purpose. Perform service account reviews to validate that all active accounts are authorized, on a recurring schedule at a minimum quarterly, or more frequently.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: An inventory of service accounts is established and maintained.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The inventory, at a minimum, contains department owner, review date, and purpose.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Service account reviews, to validate that all active accounts are authorized, are performed on a recurring schedule at a minimum, quarterly, or more frequently.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Centralize account management through a directory or identity service.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Account management is centralized through a directory or identity service.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Use processes and tools to create, assign, manage, and revoke access credentials and privileges for user, administrator, and service accounts for enterprise assets and software.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and follow a documented process, preferably automated, for granting access to enterprise assets upon new hire or role change of a user.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A documented process, preferably automated, is established and followed, for granting access to enterprise assets upon new hire or role change of a user.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and follow a process, preferably automated, for revoking access to enterprise assets, through disabling accounts immediately upon termination, rights revocation, or role change of a user. Disabling accounts, instead of deleting accounts, may be necessary to preserve audit trails.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A process, preferably automated, is established and followed for revoking access to enterprise assets, through disabling accounts immediately upon termination, rights revocation, or role change of a user.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Accounts are disabled, instead of deleted, if needed, to preserve audit trails.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Require all externally-exposed enterprise or third-party applications to enforce MFA, where supported. Enforcing MFA through a directory service or SSO provider is a satisfactory implementation of this Safeguard.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: All externally-exposed enterprise or third-party applications enforce MFA, where supported.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementation includes enforcing MFA through a directory service or SSO provider.

controls.title: Require MFA for Remote Network Access

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Require MFA for remote network access.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: MFA is required for remote network access.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Require MFA for all administrative access accounts, where supported, on all enterprise assets, whether managed on-site or through a service provider.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: MFA is required for all administrative access accounts, where supported, on all enterprise assets, whether managed on-site or through a service provider.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Authentication and Authorization Systems

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain an inventory of the enterprise's authentication and authorization systems, including those hosted on-site or at a remote service provider. Review and update the inventory, at a minimum, annually, or more frequently.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: An inventory of the enterprise's authentication and authorization systems is established and maintained, including those hosted on-site or at a remote service provider.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The inventory is reviewed and updated, at a minimum, annually, or more frequently.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Centralize access control for all enterprise assets through a directory service or SSO provider, where supported.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Access control is centralized for all enterprise assets through a directory service or SSO provider, where supported.

controls.title: Define and Maintain Role-Based Access Control

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Define and maintain role-based access control, through determining and documenting the access rights necessary for each role within the enterprise to successfully carry out its assigned duties. Perform access control reviews of enterprise assets to validate that all privileges are authorized, on a recurring schedule at a minimum annually, or more frequently.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Role-based access control is defined and maintained, through determining and documenting the access rights necessary for each role within the enterprise to successfully carry out its assigned duties.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Access control reviews of enterprise assets are performed to validate that all privileges are authorized.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Reviews are performed on a recurring schedule, at a minimum annually, or more frequently.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Develop a plan to continuously assess and track vulnerabilities on all enterprise assets within the enterprise's infrastructure, in order to remediate, and minimize, the window of opportunity for attackers. Monitor public and private industry sources for new threat and vulnerability information.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Vulnerability Management Process

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain a documented vulnerability management process for enterprise assets. Review and update documentation annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A documented vulnerability management process is established and maintained for enterprise assets.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Documentation is reviewed and updated annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Remediation Process

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain a risk-based remediation strategy documented in a remediation process, with monthly, or more frequent, reviews.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A risk-based remediation strategy, documented in a remediation process, is established and maintained.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Reviews occur monthly, or more frequently.

controls.title: Perform Automated Operating System Patch Management

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Perform operating system updates on enterprise assets through automated patch management on a monthly, or more frequent, basis.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Operating system updates are performed on enterprise assets through automated patch management.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Patching occurs on a monthly, or more frequent, basis.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Perform application updates on enterprise assets through automated patch management on a monthly, or more frequent, basis.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Application updates are performed on enterprise assets through automated patch management.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Patching occurs on a monthly, or more frequent, basis.

controls.title: Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Internal Enterprise Assets

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Perform automated vulnerability scans of internal enterprise assets on a quarterly, or more frequent, basis. Conduct both authenticated and unauthenticated scans.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Automated vulnerability scans of internal enterprise assets are performed.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Scans are conducted on a quarterly, or more frequent, basis.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Both authenticated and unauthenticated scans are conducted.

controls.title: Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Externally-Exposed Enterprise Assets

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Perform automated vulnerability scans of externally-exposed enterprise assets. Perform scans on a monthly, or more frequent, basis.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Automated vulnerability scans of externally-exposed enterprise assets are performed.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Scans are performed on a monthly, or more frequent, basis.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Remediate detected vulnerabilities in software through processes and tooling on a monthly, or more frequent, basis, based on the remediation process.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Detected vulnerabilities are remediated in software through processes and tooling.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Vulnerabilities are remediated on a monthly, or more frequent basis, based on the remediation process.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Collect, alert, review, and retain audit logs of events that could help detect, understand, or recover from an attack.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain an Audit Log Management Process

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain a documented audit log management process that defines the enterprise's logging requirements. At a minimum, address the collection, review, and retention of audit logs for enterprise assets. Review and update documentation annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A documented audit log management process is established and maintained that defines the enterprise's logging requirements.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: At a minimum, the collection, review, and retention of audit logs are addressed for enterprise assets.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Documentation is reviewed and updated annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Collect audit logs. Ensure that logging, per the enterprise's audit log management process, has been enabled across enterprise assets.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Audit logs are collected.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Logging, per the enterprise's audit log management process, has been enabled across enterprise assets.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Ensure that logging destinations maintain adequate storage to comply with the enterprise's audit log management process.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Logging destinations maintain adequate storage to comply with the enterprise's audit log management process.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Standardize time synchronization. Configure at least two synchronized time sources across enterprise assets, where supported.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Time synchronization is standardized.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: At least two synchronized time sources are configured across enterprise assets, where supported.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Configure detailed audit logging for enterprise assets containing sensitive data. Include event source, date, username, timestamp, source addresses, destination addresses, and other useful elements that could assist in a forensic investigation.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Detailed audit logging for enterprise assets containing sensitive data is configured.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Logs collect event source, date, username, timestamp, source addresses, destination addresses, and other useful elements that could assist in a forensic investigation.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Collect DNS query audit logs on enterprise assets, where appropriate and supported.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: DNS query audit logs are collected on enterprise assets, where appropriate and supported.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Collect URL request audit logs on enterprise assets, where appropriate and supported.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: URL request audit logs are collected on enterprise assets, where appropriate and supported.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Collect command-line audit logs. Example implementations include collecting audit logs from PowerShell, BASH, and remote administrative terminals.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Command-line audit logs are collected.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations include collecting audit logs from PowerShell, BASH, and remote administrative terminals.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Centralize, to the extent possible, audit log collection and retention across enterprise assets in accordance with the documented audit log management process. Example implementations primarily include leveraging a SIEM tool to centralize multiple log sources.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: To the extent possible, audit log collection and retention is centralized across enterprise assets in accordance with the documented audit log management process.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations primarily include leveraging a SIEM tool to centralize multiple log sources.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Retain audit logs across enterprise assets for a minimum of 90 days.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Audit logs are retained across enterprise assets.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Audit logs are retained for a minimum of 90 days.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Conduct reviews of audit logs to detect anomalies or abnormal events that could indicate a potential threat. Conduct reviews on a weekly, or more frequent, basis.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Reviews of audit logs are conducted to detect anomalies or abnormal events that could indicate a potential threat.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Reviews are conducted on a weekly, or more frequent, basis.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Collect service provider logs, where supported. Example implementations include collecting authentication and authorization events, data creation and disposal events, and user management events.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Service provider logs, where supported, are collected.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations include collecting authentication and authorization events, data creation and disposal events, and user management events.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Improve protections and detections of threats from email and web vectors, as these are opportunities for attackers to manipulate human behavior through direct engagement.

controls.title: Ensure Use of Only Fully Supported Browsers and Email Clients

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Ensure only fully supported browsers and email clients are allowed to execute in the enterprise, only using the latest version of browsers and email clients provided through the vendor.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Only fully supported browsers and email clients are allowed to execute in the enterprise.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Only the latest version of browsers and email clients provided through the vendor is used.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Use DNS filtering services on all end-user devices, including remote and on-premises assets, to block access to known malicious domains.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: DNS filtering services are used on all end-user devices, including remote and on-premises assets, to block access to known malicious domains.

controls.title: Maintain and Enforce Network-Based URL Filters

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Enforce and update network-based URL filters to limit an enterprise asset from connecting to potentially malicious or unapproved websites. Example implementations include category-based filtering, reputation-based filtering, or through the use of block lists. Enforce filters for all enterprise assets.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Network-based URL filters are enforced and updated to limit an enterprise asset from connecting to potentially malicious or unapproved websites.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Filters are enforced for all enterprise assets.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations include category-based filtering, reputation-based filtering, or through the use of block lists.

controls.title: Restrict Unnecessary or Unauthorized Browser and Email Client Extensions

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Restrict, either through uninstalling or disabling, any unauthorized or unnecessary browser or email client plugins, extensions, and add-on applications.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Any unauthorized or unnecessary browser or email client plugins, extensions, and add-on applications are restricted, either through uninstalling or disabling them.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: To lower the chance of spoofed or modified emails from valid domains, implement DMARC policy and verification, starting with implementing the Sender Policy Framework (SPF) and the DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) standards.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A DMARC policy and verification is implemented, starting with implementing the Sender Policy Framework (SPF) and the DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) standards.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Block unnecessary file types attempting to enter the enterprise's email gateway.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Unnecessary file types are blocked that are attempting to enter the enterprise's email gateway.

controls.title: Deploy and Maintain Email Server Anti-Malware Protections

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Deploy and maintain email server anti-malware protections, such as attachment scanning and/or sandboxing.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Email server anti-malware protections are deployed and maintained.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementation include attachment scanning and/or sandboxing.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Prevent or control the installation, spread, and execution of malicious applications, code, or scripts on enterprise assets.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Deploy and maintain anti-malware software on all enterprise assets.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Anti-malware software is deployed and maintained on all enterprise assets.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Configure automatic updates for anti-malware signature files on all enterprise assets.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Automatic updates are configured for anti-malware signature files on all enterprise assets.

controls.title: Disable Autorun and Autoplay for Removable Media

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Disable autorun and autoplay auto-execute functionality for removable media.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Autorun and autoplay, an auto-execute functionality, is disabled for removable media.

controls.title: Configure Automatic Anti-Malware Scanning of Removable Media

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Configure anti-malware software to automatically scan removable media.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Anti-malware software is configured to automatically scan removable media.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Enable anti-exploitation features on enterprise assets and software, where possible, such as Microsoft Data Execution Prevention (DEP), Windows Defender Exploit Guard (WDEG), or Apple System Integrity Protection (SIP) and Gatekeeper.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Anti-exploitation features are enabled on enterprise assets and software, where possible.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations include Microsoft Data Execution Prevention (DEP), Windows Defender Exploit Guard (WDEG), or Apple System Integrity Protection (SIP) and Gatekeeper.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Centrally manage anti-malware software.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Anti-malware software is centrally managed.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Use behavior-based anti-malware software.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Behavior-based anti-malware software is used.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain data recovery practices sufficient to restore in-scope enterprise assets to a pre-incident and trusted state.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Recovery Process

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain a documented data recovery process that includes detailed backup procedures. In the process, address the scope of data recovery activities, recovery prioritization, and the security of backup data. Review and update documentation annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A documented data recovery process that includes detailed backup procedures is established and maintained.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The process addresses the scope of data recovery activities, recovery prioritization, and the security of backup data.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The documentation is reviewed and updated annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Perform automated backups of in-scope enterprise assets. Run backups weekly, or more frequently, based on the sensitivity of the data.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Automated backups are performed on in-scope enterprise assets.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Backups are run weekly, or more frequently, based on the sensitivity of the data.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Protect recovery data with equivalent controls to the original data. Reference encryption or data separation, based on requirements.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Recovery data is protected with equivalent controls to the original data.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Encryption or data separation is used, based on requirements.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain an Isolated Instance of Recovery Data

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain an isolated instance of recovery data. Example implementations include, version controlling backup destinations through offline, cloud, or off-site systems or services.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: An isolated instance of recovery data is established and maintained.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations include, version controlling backup destinations through offline, cloud, or off-site systems or services.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Test backup recovery quarterly, or more frequently, for a sampling of in-scope enterprise assets.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Backup recovery is tested for a sampling of in-scope enterprise assets.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Backup recovery is tested quarterly, or more frequently.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish, implement, and actively manage (track, report, correct) network devices, in order to prevent attackers from exploiting vulnerable network services and access points.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Ensure network infrastructure is kept up-to-date. Example implementations include running the latest stable release of software and/or using currently supported network as a service (Naas) offerings. Review software versions monthly, or more frequently, to verify software support.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Network infrastructure is kept up to date.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Software versions are reviewed monthly, or more frequently, to verify software support.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations include running the latest stable release of software and/or using currently supported network as a service (NaaS) offerings.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Secure Network Architecture

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Design and maintain a secure network architecture. A secure network architecture must address segmentation, least privilege, and availability, at a minimum. Example implementations may include documentation, policy, and design components.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A secure network architecture is designed and maintained.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The secure network architecture addresses segmentation, least privilege, and availability, at a minimum.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations may include documentation, policy, and design components.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Securely manage network infrastructure. Example implementations include version-controlled Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC), and the use of secure network protocols, such as SSH and HTTPS.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Network infrastructure is securely managed.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations include version-controlled Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) and the use of secure network protocols, such as SSH and HTTPS.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain architecture diagram(s) and/or other network system documentation. Review and update documentation annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Architecture diagram(s) and/or other network system documentation is established and maintained.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Documentation is reviewed and updated annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

controls.title: Centralize Network Authentication, Authorization, and Auditing (AAA)

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Centralize network AAA.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Network AAA is centralized.

controls.title: Use of Secure Network Management and Communication Protocols

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Adopt secure network management protocols (e.g., 802.1X) and secure communication protocols (e.g., Wi-Fi Protected Access 2 (WPA2) Enterprise or more secure alternatives).

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Secure network management and communication protocols are adopted.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Examples include 802.1X, Wi-Fi Protected Access 2 (WPA2) Enterprise or more secure alternatives.

controls.title: Ensure Remote Devices Utilize a VPN and are Connecting to an Enterprise's AAA Infrastructure

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Require users to authenticate to enterprise-managed VPN and authentication services prior to accessing enterprise resources on end-user devices.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Users are required to authenticate to enterprise-managed VPN and authentication services prior to accessing enterprise resources on end-user devices.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain Dedicated Computing Resources for All Administrative Work

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain dedicated computing resources, either physically or logically separated, for all administrative tasks or tasks requiring administrative access. The computing resources should be segmented from the enterprise's primary network and not be allowed internet access.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Dedicated computing resources, either physically or logically separated, are established and maintained for all administrative tasks or tasks requiring administrative access.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The computing resources are segmented from the enterprise's primary network and are not allowed internet access.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Operate processes and tooling to establish and maintain comprehensive network monitoring and defense against security threats across the enterprise's network infrastructure and user base.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Centralize security event alerting across enterprise assets for log correlation and analysis. Best practice implementation requires the use of a SIEM, which includes vendor-defined event correlation alerts. A log analytics platform configured with security-relevant correlation alerts also satisfies this Safeguard.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Security event alerting is centralized across enterprise assets for log correlation and analysis.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementation includes the use of a SIEM, which includes vendor-defined event correlation alerts, or a log analytics platform configured with security-relevant correlation alerts.

controls.title: Deploy a Host-Based Intrusion Detection Solution

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Deploy a host-based intrusion detection solution on enterprise assets, where appropriate and/or supported.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A host-based intrusion detection solution is deployed on enterprise assets, where appropriate and/or supported.

controls.title: Deploy a Network Intrusion Detection Solution

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Deploy a network intrusion detection solution on enterprise assets, where appropriate. Example implementations include the use of a Network Intrusion Detection System (NIDS) or equivalent cloud service provider (CSP) service.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A network intrusion detection solution is deployed on enterprise assets, where appropriate.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations include the use of a Network Intrusion Detection System (NIDS) or equivalent cloud service provider (CSP) service.

controls.title: Perform Traffic Filtering Between Network Segments

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Perform traffic filtering between network segments, where appropriate.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Traffic filtering between network segments is performed, where appropriate.

controls.title: Manage Access Control for Remote Assets

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Manage access control for assets remotely connecting to enterprise resources. Determine amount of access to enterprise resources based on: up-to-date anti-malware software installed, configuration compliance with the enterprise's secure configuration process, and ensuring the operating system and applications are up-to-date.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Access control is managed for assets remotely connecting to enterprise resources.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The amount of access to enterprise resources is determined based on: up-to-date anti-malware software installed, configuration compliance with the enterprise's secure configuration process, and ensuring the operating system and applications are up to date.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Collect network traffic flow logs and/or network traffic to review and alert upon from network devices.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Network traffic flow logs and/or network traffic is collected to review and alert upon from network devices.

controls.title: Deploy a Host-Based Intrusion Prevention Solution

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Deploy a host-based intrusion prevention solution on enterprise assets, where appropriate and/or supported. Example implementations include use of an Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) client or host-based IPS agent.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A host-based intrusion prevention solution is deployed on enterprise assets, where appropriate and/or supported.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations include use of an Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) client or host-based IPS agent.

controls.title: Deploy a Network Intrusion Prevention Solution

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Deploy a network intrusion prevention solution, where appropriate. Example implementations include the use of a Network Intrusion Prevention System (NIPS) or equivalent CSP service.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A network intrusion prevention solution is deployed, where appropriate.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations include the use of a Network Intrusion Prevention System (NIPS) or equivalent CSP service.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Deploy port-level access control. Port-level access control utilizes 802.1x, or similar network access control protocols, such as certificates, and may incorporate user and/or device authentication.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Port-level access control is deployed.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Port-level access control utilizes 802.1x, or similar network access control protocols, such as certificates, and may incorporate user and/or device authentication.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Perform application layer filtering. Example implementations include a filtering proxy, application layer firewall, or gateway.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Application layer filtering is performed.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations include a filtering proxy, application layer firewall, or gateway.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Tune security event alerting thresholds monthly, or more frequently.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Security event alerting thresholds are tuned.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Tuning is done on a monthly, or more frequent, basis.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain a security awareness program to influence behavior among the workforce to be security conscious and properly skilled to reduce cybersecurity risks to the enterprise.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Security Awareness Program

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain a security awareness program. The purpose of a security awareness program is to educate the enterprise's workforce on how to interact with enterprise assets and data in a secure manner. Conduct training at hire and, at a minimum, annually. Review and update content annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A security awareness program is established and maintained to educate the enterprise's workforce on how to interact with enterprise assets and data in a secure manner.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Training is conducted at hire and, at a minimum, annually.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Content is reviewed and updated annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

controls.title: Train Workforce Members to Recognize Social Engineering Attacks

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Train workforce members to recognize social engineering attacks, such as phishing, business email compromise (BEC), pretexting, and tailgating.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Workforce members are trained to recognize social engineering attacks, such as phishing, business email compromise (BEC), pretexting, and tailgating.

controls.title: Train Workforce Members on Authentication Best Practices

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Train workforce members on authentication best practices. Example topics include MFA, password composition, and credential management.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Workforce members are trained on authentication best practices.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example topics include MFA, password composition, and credential management.

controls.title: Train Workforce on Data Handling Best Practices

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Train workforce members on how to identify and properly store, transfer, archive, and destroy sensitive data. This also includes training workforce members on clear screen and desk best practices, such as locking their screen when they step away from their enterprise asset, erasing physical and virtual whiteboards at the end of meetings, and storing data and assets securely.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Workforce members are trained on how to identify and properly store, transfer, archive, and destroy sensitive data.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Training includes clear screen and desk best practices, such as locking their screen when they step away from their enterprise asset, erasing physical and virtual whiteboards at the end of meetings, and storing data and assets securely.

controls.title: Train Workforce Members on Causes of Unintentional Data Exposure

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Train workforce members to be aware of causes for unintentional data exposure. Example topics include mis-delivery of sensitive data, losing a portable end-user device, or publishing data to unintended audiences.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Workforce members are trained to be aware of causes for unintentional data exposure.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example topics include mis-delivery of sensitive data, losing a portable end-user device, or publishing data to unintended audiences.

controls.title: Train Workforce Members on Recognizing and Reporting Security Incidents

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Train workforce members to be able to recognize a potential incident and be able to report such an incident.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Workforce members are trained to recognize a potential incident and to report such an incident.

controls.title: Train Workforce on How to Identify and Report if Their Enterprise Assets are Missing Security Updates

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Train workforce to understand how to verify and report out-of-date software patches or any failures in automated processes and tools. Part of this training should include notifying IT personnel of any failures in automated processes and tools.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Workforce is trained to understand how to verify and report out-of-date software patches or any failures in automated processes and tools.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Training includes notifying IT personnel of any failures in automated processes and tools.

controls.title: Train Workforce on the Dangers of Connecting to and Transmitting Enterprise Data Over Insecure Networks

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Train workforce members on the dangers of connecting to, and transmitting data over, insecure networks for enterprise activities. If the enterprise has remote workers, training must include guidance to ensure that all users securely configure their home network infrastructure.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Workforce members are trained on the dangers of connecting to and transmitting data over insecure networks for enterprise activities.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: For enterprises with remote workers, training includes guidance to ensure that all users securely configure their home network infrastructure.

controls.title: Conduct Role-Specific Security Awareness and Skills Training

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Conduct role-specific security awareness and skills training. Example implementations include secure system administration courses for IT professionals, OWASP Top 10 vulnerability awareness and prevention training for web application developers, and advanced social engineering awareness training for high-profile roles.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Role-specific security awareness and skills training is conducted.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example implementations include secure system administration courses for IT professionals, OWASP Top 10 vulnerability awareness and prevention training for web application developers, and advanced social engineering awareness training for high-profile roles.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Develop a process to evaluate service providers who hold sensitive data, or are responsible for an enterprise's critical IT platforms or processes, to ensure these providers are protecting those platforms and data appropriately.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Service Providers

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain an inventory of service providers. The inventory is to list all known service providers, include classification(s), and designate an enterprise contact for each service provider. Review and update the inventory annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: An inventory of service providers is established and maintained.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The inventory lists all known service providers, including classification(s), and designates an enterprise contact for each service provider.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The inventory is reviewed and updated annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Service Provider Management Policy

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain a service provider management policy. Ensure the policy addresses the classification, inventory, assessment, monitoring, and decommissioning of service providers. Review and update the policy annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A service provider management policy is established and maintained.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The policy addresses the classification, inventory, assessment, monitoring, and decommissioning of service providers.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The policy is reviewed and updated annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Classify service providers. Classification consideration may include one or more characteristics, such as data sensitivity, data volume, availability requirements, applicable regulations, inherent risk, and mitigated risk. Update and review classifications annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Service providers are classified.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Classifications are reviewed and updated annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Classification consideration includes one or more characteristics, such as data sensitivity, data volume, availability requirements, applicable regulations, inherent risk, and mitigated risk.

controls.title: Ensure Service Provider Contracts Include Security Requirements

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Ensure service provider contracts include security requirements. Example requirements may include minimum security program requirements, security incident and/or data breach notification and response, data encryption requirements, and data disposal commitments. These security requirements must be consistent with the enterprise's service provider management policy. Review service provider contracts annually to ensure contracts are not missing security requirements.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Service provider contracts include security requirements.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Security requirements are consistent with the enterprise's service provider management policy.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Service provider contracts are reviewed annually to ensure contracts are not missing security requirements.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example requirements include minimum security program requirements, security incident and/or data breach notification and response, data encryption requirements, and data disposal commitments.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Assess service providers consistent with the enterprise's service provider management policy. Assessment scope may vary based on classification(s), and may include review of standardized assessment reports, such as Service Organization Control 2 (SOC 2) and Payment Card Industry (PCI) Attestation of Compliance (AoC), customized questionnaires, or other appropriately rigorous processes. Reassess service providers annually, at a minimum, or with new and renewed contracts.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Service providers are assessed consistent with the enterprise's service provider management policy.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Service providers are reassessed annually, at a minimum, or with new and renewed contracts.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Assessment scope varies based on classification(s) and may include review of standardized assessment reports, such as Service Organization Control 2 (SOC 2) and Payment Card Industry (PCI) Attestation of Compliance (AoC), customized questionnaires, or other appropriately rigorous processes.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Monitor service providers consistent with the enterprise's service provider management policy. Monitoring may include periodic reassessment of service provider compliance, monitoring service provider release notes, and dark web monitoring.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Service providers are monitored consistent with the enterprise's service provider management policy.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Monitoring may include periodic reassessment of service provider compliance, monitoring service provider release notes, and dark web monitoring.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Securely decommission service providers. Example considerations include user and service account deactivation, termination of data flows, and secure disposal of enterprise data within service provider systems.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: Service providers are securely decommissioned.

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Example considerations include user and service account deactivation, termination of data flows, and secure disposal of enterprise data within service provider systems.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Manage the security life cycle of in-house developed, hosted, or acquired software to prevent, detect, and remediate security weaknesses before they can impact the enterprise.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Secure Application Development Process

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain a secure application development process. In the process, address such items as: secure application design standards, secure coding practices, developer training, vulnerability management, security of third-party code, and application security testing procedures. Review and update documentation annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: A secure application development process is established and maintained.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The process addresses items such as: secure application design standards, secure coding practices, developer training, vulnerability management, security of third-party code, and application security testing procedures.

parts.name: assessment-objective
parts.prose: The documentation is reviewed and updated annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this Safeguard.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Process to Accept and Address Software Vulnerabilities

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Establish and maintain a process to accept and address reports of software vulnerabilities, including providing a means for external entities to report.
